content: quick knit baby shrug designed by natalie haban for nat & callie knits size is for 12-18 months and since i used my daughter as my mannequin here s what i came up with i will try and work other sizes in once i get a chance enjoy needles us 10 6mm or size to obtain gauge i used straight needles but circular or dp are recommended gauge 4 sts = 1 in st st other stuff 4 stitch markers dp needles optional embroidery floss needle & tapestry needle ws wrong side kfb knit front and back rs right side k knit p purl cast on 45 stitches and work in 1x1 rib k1 p1 for 3 row if using circular or dp needles do not join just knit back and forth as with straight needles if adding a button hole do this on the second row as a yo k2tog on the third stitch in note the set-up row for the stitch markers is on the wrong side ws copyright © 2011 nat & callie knits all rights reserved row 4 set-up ws slip 1 k2 p6 place marker p7 place marker p13 place marker p7 place marker p6 k3 row 5 increase rs slip 1 k2 *knit to 2 stitches before marker kfb k1 slip marker k1 kfb and repeat from * three more times knit to end of row row 6 slip 1 k2 purl to last 3 stitches k3 note always slip the first stitch of every row repeat row 5 & 6 for at least 9-11 more times for the next 3 row knit 1x1 rib on the sleeve portion only end on ws to form sleeves on ws slip 1 k2 purl to the stitch before marker and begin to bind off purl wise till the next stitch marker remove all stitch markers as you come to them and only bind off in the sleeve part do this for the second sleeve purl to last 3 stitches k3 next row rs slip 1 knit to end next row ws slip1 k2 purl to last 3 stitches k3 repeat last two row 4-5 more times time to begin 1x1 rib for the bottom of the shrug next row rs slip 1 k1 p1 in 1x1 rib to end next row ws slip 1 continue in 1x1 rib as established next row rs slip 1 k1 p1 in 1x1 rib to end bind off next row purl wise and weave in all loose ends optional hook using dp needles co 3 stitches and knit an i-cord as long as needed in order to create a loop big enough for your button to pass through bind off and sew onto shrug at the top sew button on opposite side feel free to embroider anything cute or fun and block to shape copyright © 2011 nat & callie knits all rights reserved
